raw_text: Another difference is that Yamada and Matsumoto use support vector machines (Vapnik, 1995), while we instead rely on memory-based learning (Daele mans, 1999)

Memory-based learning and problem solving is based on two fundamental principles: learning is the simple storage of experiences in memory, and solving a new problem is achieved by reusing solutions from similar previously solved problems (Daele mans, 1999)
We are grateful to Yamada and Matsumoto for letting us use their rule set, which is a slight modification of the rules used by Collins (1999)

raw_text: As the interest of the NLP community grows to encompass more languages, we observe efforts towards adapting an English parser for parsing other languages (e.g., (Collins et al, 1999)), or towards designing a language-independent framework based on principles underlying the models for parsing English (Bikel, 2002)
clean_text: As the interest of the NLP community grows to encompass more languages, we observe efforts towards adapting an English parser for parsing other languages (e.g., (Collins et al, 1999)), or towards designing a language-independent framework based on principles underlying the models for parsing English (Bikel, 2002).

raw_text: Hence ,morphology gives us important structural cues about how the words in a Spanish sentence relate to one another. The mechanism we employ for incorporating morphology into the PCFG model (the Model 1 parser in (Collins, 1999)) is the modification of its part-of speech (POS) tag set; in this paper, we explain how this mechanism allows the parser to better capture morphological constraints
clean_text: The mechanism we employ for incorporating morphology into the PCFG model (the Model 1 parser in (Collins, 1999)) is the modification of its part-of speech (POS) tag set; in this paper, we explain how this mechanism allows the parser to better capture morphological constraints.

raw_text: The authors in (Collins et al, 1999) describe an approach that gives 80% accuracy in recovering unlabeled dependencies in Czech.1 The project that is arguably most akin to the work presented in this paper is that on Spanish parsing (Moreno et al, 2000)
clean_text: The authors in (Collins et al, 1999) describe an approach that gives 80% accuracy in recovering unlabeled dependencies in Czech.
